summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying motions to quash a subpoena and ordering the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to produce materials for court review. The order also directs the parties to negotiate a protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who issued a Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, denying motions to quash and setting deadlines for document production and protective order negotiation.

persons.name: Administrator Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: Filed a motion to quash the defendant's subpoena and requested oral argument, which was denied by the court.

connections.description: Maxwell issued a subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, which Feldman administers, leading Feldman to file a motion to quash that was denied.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding subpoena procedures.
Judge Nathan denied Feldman's motion to quash and request for oral argument, ordering Feldman to produce materials to the court.

events.title: Court Order on Subpoena Motions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and ordered document production.

events.title: Deadline for Document Production and Protective Order
events.description: The court set a deadline for the Administrator to produce subpoenaed materials and for the parties to submit a proposed protective order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
The Administrator of the program, Feldman, was ordered to produce responsive materials to the court by November 24, 2021.
The court indicated it would review the materials first and might allow party inspection under a protective order to prevent trial delay.
The parties were ordered to negotiate and submit a protective order proposal by the same deadline.
